library.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
library.author: Gabriel García Márquez
library.description: One Hundred Years of Solitude tells the story of the rise and fall, birth and death of a mythical town of Macondo through the history of the Buendía family. Inventive, amusing, magnetic, sad, alive with unforgettable men and women, and with a truth and understanding that strike the soul.

library.title: Serpentine
library.author: Cindy Pon
library.description: SERPENTINE is a sweeping fantasy set in the ancient Kingdom of Xia and inspired by the rich history of Chinese mythology. Lush with details from Chinese folklore, SERPENTINE tells the coming of age story of Skybright, a young girl who worries about her growing otherness.

library.title: Atomic Habits
library.author: James Clear
library.description: Atomic Habits is the definitive guide to breaking bad behaviors and adopting good ones in four steps, showing you how small, incremental, everyday routines compound into massive, positive change over.

library.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
library.author: Harper Lee
library.description: Considered one of the greatest novels of all time, "To Kill a Mockingbird" is an unforgettable historical fiction novel from 1960 that follows young Jean Louise Finch during a time of great racial inequality in her community.
